intro: Pimpinella sutchuensis, commonly known as the Sutchuan cowparsnip, is a herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is known for its aromatic foliage. It has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological and medicinal research.
